segments.text: How's your time spent in the United States ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I'm glad to hear that . What impressed you most ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , the cultural differences impressed me most .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You mean we Chinese think differently from the Americans ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That's right , quite different . One day one of my American friend looked pale , so I asked him whether he was sick or not . But he was reluctant to answer my question .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: And what's more , when he told me he had caught a cold for several days , I suggested him to go to the hospital as soon as possible .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You really cared about your friend .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Sure I am . But he responded by saying'what do you mean ? ' .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I'm confused . Why did he say that ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I felt the same at first . Later he told me that I'd better not give him any suggestions when he was sick . Offering unsolicited help or advice is like showing sympathy to the weak or the poor . But back in China , helping others is always regarded being kind .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Absolutely . Now I understand why he responded that way .
segments.speaker: S1
